content:
Hi folks,
I am checking how zulip deals with authentication logs.
I need to know where exactly authentication logs are written and start writing a parser for crowdsec : https://crowdsec.net/

  • /home/zulip/logs/ : nothing
  • /var/log/auth.log : nothing
  • /var/log/zulip/ldap.log : contains auth logs, only because I use ldap right ? (debug)

Is there a "centralized" log for any kind of authentication in zulip ? (Do not hesitate to tell if I'm not clear :smile:)

Regards,
This topic was moved here from #learning > auth logs by Greg Price
Hi @Unam ! Sorry you haven't gotten an answer to this question yet. I've moved it to our #production help stream, which may make it more likely for someone to see it who can give you a good answer.
If you're looking for a location where we log authentication attempts, I don't believe Zulip has a consistent one right now. It certainly would be a reasonable thing to change.
